holidays.name: Senior Citizens Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to honoring and appreciating the wisdom, experience, and contributions of senior citizens worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established in 1991 by a joint resolution of the U.S. Congress and signed into law by President George H.W. Bush to recognize the importance of older adults in society.
holidays.funFact: The oldest known person celebrated on this day was Jeanne Calment, who lived to 122 years and 164 days â€” the longest verified human lifespan!

holidays.name: Spumoni Day
holidays.description: A delicious celebration of Spumoni, an Italian layered ice cream dessert featuring flavors like cherry, pistachio, and chocolate with candied fruits and nuts.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday appreciating Spumoniâ€™s rich flavor and colorful layers, often enjoyed on hot summer days.
holidays.funFact: Spumoni means 'foam' in Italian, referring to the airy texture of its whipped cream base!

holidays.name: Happiness Happens Day
holidays.description: A joyful reminder to take a moment to appreciate and spread happiness, no matter how small or simple the cause.
holidays.origin: Created by the Secret Society of Happy People in 1999 to inspire people to express happiness openly and cheerfully.
holidays.funFact: The founder, Anne Herbert, coined the phrase 'Practice random kindness and senseless acts of beauty.'

holidays.name: National Senior Citizens Day
holidays.description: Distinct from general senior observances, this day emphasizes the rights and needs of senior citizens, promoting dignity and respect.
holidays.origin: Recognized primarily in the United States to pay tribute to seniors and advocate for their well-being.
holidays.funFact: 190 countries have some form of observance for older persons, but August 21 is uniquely American!

holidays.name: Pecan Pie Day
holidays.description: A nutty and sweet day celebrating the classic American dessert pecan pie, loved especially in Southern cuisine.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food observance honoring pecan pieâ€™s history dating back to the late 19th century.
holidays.funFact: Texas produces 80% of the U.S. pecan crop, the star ingredient of pecan pie!
